intro: Pedicularis gruina var. cinerascens, commonly known as the cinerascens lousewort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic or hemiparasitic growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with a distinctive spurred shape that aids in pollination by insects. The leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine, hairy structures, contributing to its overall appearance and ecological interactions.
